name: Lloyds of Chester

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this hotel was ideal for what we wanted.it was 10 mins walk from city centre,and the breakfasts were great.the hotel owner was very kind and helpful.we would recommend it,and we would stay again.
reviews.title: excellent value for money

reviews.text: Stayed in Family room 1 double 1 single bed . Room was nice and clean but oh the en suite , smaller than anything I have seen in a caravan and quite a bit of careful manouvering to even use the loo ! , No free parking but hotel location good , Breakfast not bad but no choice of brown toast and only 2 cereal and 1one fruit juice option .
reviews.title: nice clean room but worlds smallest en suite !

reviews.text: Great little find 5 min walk from chester city centre and 10 min drive to the zoo. Lovely Clean spacious rooms very family friendly nice quality breakfast and a very welcoming host "Sal". We really enjoyed our stay and so did our 2 year old. The bathroom in the room was small but very clean and had all we needed. This is not a complaint about the bathroom just to let others know to expect this. Excellent value for money and would recommened a stay to anyone with kids visiting chester or the zoo
reviews.title: excellent base for chester city visits and zoo visitors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for weekend ,great location 2mins railway station 5mins centre,plenty of restaurants and couple of pubs on doorstep.Hotel was lovely and clean and the owner could,nt do enough for us he,s a lovely man,yes the bathrooms are tiny but there,s everything you need.
reviews.title: Brilliant little hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at Llyods hotel bathroom was very small .Breakfast nothing like as described on the website, no choice of fruit juice's only orange juice and only a choice of 2 cereals rather than the ones described on web. Not value for money and certainly wouldnt be happy to pay full price.
reviews.title: Nothing like info on Website

reviews.text: "Luxury" hotel? Noooo. The bathroom in this place was like a plastic cupboard. The room was clean but the bath towel (which I had to search for) wasn't. No bathmat, no handtowel, no toiletries. Hallway smelt of cleaning product. The staff had limited English. My "key" didn't work. The advertised parking was in a back alley. In the end I found somewhere else and didn't stay there. The owner didn't seem remotely interested or bothered. No apology.
reviews.title: Don't bother

reviews.text: A place to avoid ! Damp walls, dirty shower curtain, dodgy pillows, plastic portaloo and shower, half used loo rolls, staff with little or no english. Dont expect to be able to use WC and close the door if you are not stick thin ! No plus points at all (even price is not as cheap as to make up for the bad experience)
reviews.title: UsedtobetterB&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well located hotel.Service was friendly and efficient.Room and hotel generally were spotless.Bathroom was compact but fine if you are a normal size.Power shower was lovely.Opted for full English breakfast with fresh orange juice toast and cereal all presented very nicely.Parked 2 minutes away at the station.£5.00 for 24 hrs.Would definitely stay again.Good value.
reviews.title: Well done LLoyds

reviews.text: I visited Chester for the annual race meetings and to my dismay found there were few hotels left available apart from the really over-priced ones. Somehow managed to track down Lloyds of Chester, which was lucky. The price was cheaper than anything else I could find, it was located 2 mins from the station and to cap it all, the room was spacious and very good value for price.
reviews.title: Best Low Cost Hotel in Chester

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd highly recommend Lloyds of Chester for anyone that is looking to stay at a centrally located hotel, at excellent prices, with very good amenities. Top find!
reviews.title: A friendly hotel in a great location

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location, rooms were comfy and large but the staff are absolutely appauling!!
reviews.title: Very very dissapointing,,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had 25 guests staying over for my hen do and had spoke to the owner several times over the last 7/8 months to make sure everything was in place, including sending a letter to confirm everything. Sal had been very helpful and had booked us taxi's to the races and a meal across the road at Donato & Sandro (excellent by the way!)
reviews.title: Possibly the smallest en suite in the world!

reviews.text: So i arrive yesterday and Sal is away, the guy that was left in charge speaks almost no English at all and had no clue what rooms i've booked, i was promised an 11am check in, only to find out the rooms won't be ready until at least 12 and all my guests are stood in the entrance after travelling from all over the country. This fiasco ended by the guy losing his temper and throwing his cig packet at the wall!! He did not have a clue what was going on and the whole place was in absolute chaos.
reviews.title: Stay???.....in another hotel!

reviews.text: Later on we go for our meal, I was told by Sal we would be able to choose our specific meal choices on arrival but instead it is a set meal, so my veggie pals had meaty pizza's! Luckily Donato & Sandro were fantastic and did what they could to cater for us all.
reviews.title: Great value hotel, with friendly owner

reviews.text: I think they have promised me things they just could not actually provide just to get my custom. The owners son then tried to play the whole situation down this morning saying they always had things under control and 11am was far too early to check in anyway! He then tried to over charge me! As we were leaving another party were also over charged and ended up storming out..
reviews.title: Fabulous... great value, lovely staff, clean room...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a double bed room for two nights over the weekend, which came with breakfast included. The room was very nice and was spacious. The room was super, having a great tv and a good iron for once in a hotel! The breakfast was nice, along with there was as much as you wanted to eat. We felt like we were being waited on idividually. As I was new to Chester I wanted to find out information, I asked behind the counter and they were very happy to help me out. The one thing that stood out from the stay at Lloyds guest house was the service. I cannot express how welcomed I felt as soon as I opened the door, with things getter better as time went by. When I needed anything, I just asked and I was delt with within minutes. I really enjoyed my stay here and would love to return. I would also recommend it to any others!
reviews.title: A* service!

reviews.text: Can I just say what a fantastic hotel. The Manager/Owner Sal is a fantastic host, he made all of us feel so welcome. From the moment we walked in, we knew we were going to have a lovely stay.
reviews.title: Not long enough
Great Hotel in Chester
reviews.text: The rooms are so clean and tidy, everything you need is there, even an iron and ironing board.
Tea and coffee, was plentiful in the room too.
reviews.title: not bad really

reviews.text: The beds were so comfortable too. Not often you can say that about a hotel.
reviews.title: Rocky Horror Show

description: Lloyds of Chester Hotel is a family owned and run hotel, conveniently located near the train station in the heart of the historic city of Chester. The city of Chester is steeped in history, culture and fantastic shopping facilities making it a perfect retreat for every occasion. Whether you are looking for a romantic retreat or a base to explore the regional attractions, Lloyds Hotel offers something special for everybody.
